1.name: 12 Angry Men
1.description: A jury holdout attempts to prevent a miscarriage of justice by forcing his colleagues to reconsider the evidence.

2.name: The Seventh Seal
2.description: A man seeks answers about life, death, and the existence of God as he plays chess against the Grim Reaper during the Black Plague.

3.name: 3:10 to Yuma
3.description: Broke small-time rancher Dan Evans is hired by the stagecoach line to put big-time captured outlaw leader Ben Wade on the 3:10 train to Yuma but Wade's gang tries to free him.

4.name: The Bridge on the River Kwai
4.description: After settling his differences with a Japanese P.O.W. camp commander, a British Colonel co-operates to oversee his men's construction of a railway bridge for their captors, while oblivious to a plan by the Allies to destroy it.

5.name: Paths of Glory
5.description: After refusing to attack an enemy position, a general accuses the soldiers of cowardice and their commanding officer must defend them.

6.name: Witness for the Prosecution
6.description: A veteran British barrister must defend his client in a murder trial that has surprise after surprise.

7.name: Wild Strawberries
7.description: After living a life marked by coldness, an aging professor is forced to confront the emptiness of his existence.

8.name: Funny Face
8.description: An impromptu fashion shoot at a book store brings about a new fashion model discovery in the shop clerk.

9.name: An Affair to Remember
9.description: A couple falls in love and agrees to meet in six months at the Empire State Building - but will it happen?

10.name: Old Yeller
10.description: A teenage boy grows to love a stray yellow dog while helping his mother and younger brother run their Texas homestead while their father is away on a cattle drive. First thought to be good-for-nothing mutt, Old Yeller is soon beloved by all.

11.name: The Nights of Cabiria
11.description: A waifish prostitute wanders the streets of Rome looking for true love but finds only heartbreak.

12.name: Throne of Blood
12.description: A war-hardened general, egged on by his ambitious wife, works to fulfill a prophecy that he would become lord of Spider's Web Castle.

13.name: Sweet Smell of Success
13.description: Powerful but unethical Broadway columnist J.J. Hunsecker coerces unscrupulous press agent Sidney Falco into breaking up his sister's romance with a jazz musician.

14.name: Night Passage
14.description: A fired railroad man is re-hired and trusted to carry a ten thousand dollar payroll in secret, even though he is suspected of being connected to outlaws.

15.name: Sayonara
15.description: A US Air Force major in Kobe confronts his own opposition to marriages between American servicemen and Japanese women when he falls for a beautiful performer.

16.name: Gunfight at the O.K. Corral
16.description: Lawman Wyatt Earp and outlaw Doc Holliday form an unlikely alliance which culminates in their participation in the legendary Gunfight at the O.K. Corral.

17.name: A Face in the Crowd
17.description: An Arkansas drifter becomes an overnight media sensation. As he becomes drunk with fame and power, will he ever be exposed as the fraud he has become?

18.name: Love in the Afternoon
18.description: A middle-aged playboy becomes fascinated by the daughter of a private detective who has been hired to entrap him with the wife of a client.

19.name: Zero Hour!
19.description: In 1950s Canada, during a commercial flight, the pilots and some passengers suffer food poisoning, thus forcing an ex-WW2 fighter pilot to try to land the airliner in heavy fog.

20.name: The Shiralee
20.description: When Jim Macauley finds his wife with another man, he takes their young daughter and they hit the road. With a young child as his responsibility, he finds he can't be quite the fancy-free ...                See full summary »

21.name: Desk Set
21.description: Two extremely strong personalities clash over the computerization of a television network's research department.

22.name: The Pajama Game
22.description: An Iowa pajama factory worker falls in love with an affable superintendent who had been hired by the factory's boss to help oppose the workers' demand for a pay rise.

23.name: The Incredible Shrinking Man
23.description: When Scott Carey begins to shrink because of exposure to a combination of radiation and insecticide, medical science is powerless to help him.

24.name: The Enemy Below
24.description: During World War II, an American destroyer meets a German U-Boat. Both captains are experts, and so begins a deadly game of cat-and-mouse.

25.name: Curse of the Demon
25.description: American professor John Holden arrives in London for a parapsychology conference, only to find himself investigating the mysterious actions of Devil-worshiper Julian Karswell.

26.name: A King in New York
26.description: A recently-deposed European monarch seeks shelter in New York City, where he becomes an accidental television celebrity and is later wrongly accused of being a Communist.

27.name: Will Success Spoil Rock Hunter?
27.description: To save his career, a writer for television advertising wants a famous actress to endorse a lipstick. In return, he has to pretend to be her new lover.

28.name: Jailhouse Rock
28.description: After serving time for manslaughter, young Vince Everett becomes a teenage rock star.

29.name: The Cranes Are Flying
29.description: Veronica plans a rendezvous with her lover, Boris, at the bank of river, only for him to be drafted into World War II shortly thereafter.

30.name: The Curse of Frankenstein
30.description: Victor Frankenstein builds a creature and brings it to life, but it behaves not as he intended.

31.name: The Burglar
31.description: Dan Duryea and his cronies rob a fake spiritualist and then take it on the lam to Atlantic City.

32.name: The Prince and the Showgirl
32.description: An American showgirl becomes entangled in political intrigue when the Prince Regent of a foreign country attempts to seduce her.

33.name: Legend of the Lost
33.description: American ne'er-do-well Joe January is hired to take Paul Bonnard on an expedition into the desert in search of treasure.

34.name: Tammy and the Bachelor
34.description: An unsophisticated young woman from the Mississippi swamps falls in love with an unconventional southern gentleman.

35.name: Peyton Place
35.description: A peaceful New England town hides secrets and scandals.

36.name: Raintree County
36.description: A student falls in love with a Southern belle, but their relationship is complicated by her troubled past and the onset of the Civil War.

37.name: Boy on a Dolphin
37.description: A woman finds a treasure and is torn between two men: one who wants to sell it and one who wants to gift it to Greece.

38.name: Pal Joey
38.description: Joey Evans is charming, handsome, funny, talented, and a first class, A-number-one heel. When Joey meets the former chorus girl ("She used to be 'Vera...with the Vanishing Veils'") and now ...                See full summary »

39.name: I Was a Teenage Werewolf
39.description: A hypnotherapist uses a temperamental teenager as guinea pig for a serum which transforms him into a vicious werewolf.

40.name: The Circle
40.description: When Dr. Howard Latimer finds the German actress that he had just met at London Airport murdered in his flat. It leads him into the world of murder, blackmail, and a fake passport scam.

41.name: Time Without Pity
41.description: The day before a young man is to be executed for killing his girlfriend, his alcoholic father shows up to try to prove his innocence.

42.name: Loving You
42.description: A musician and a publicist help a delivery man achieve stardom.

43.name: The Three Faces of Eve
43.description: A doctor treats a woman suffering from Multiple Personality Disorder.

44.name: The Giant Claw
44.description: Global panic ensues when it is revealed that a mysterious UFO is actually a giant bird that flies at supersonic speed and has no regard for life or architecture.

45.name: Invasion of the Saucer Men
45.description: A teenage couple accidentally awakens an alien after hitting it with their car.

46.name: The Wings of Eagles
46.description: A biography of Navy flier-turned-screenwriter Frank W. "Spig" Read.

47.name: Hell Drivers
47.description: Ex-con trucker tries to expose his boss' rackets.

48.name: Run of the Arrow
48.description: When the South loses the war, Confederate veteran O'Meara goes West, joins the Sioux, takes a wife and refuses to be an American but he must choose a side when the Sioux go to war against the U.S. Army.

49.name: Designing Woman
49.description: A sportswriter and a fashion-designer marry after a whirlwind romance, and discover they have little in common.

50.name: Silk Stockings
50.description: A musical remake of Ninotchka: After three bumbling Soviet agents fail in their mission to retrieve a straying Soviet composer from Paris, the beautiful, ultra-serious Ninotchka is sent to ...                See full summary »
